import React from "react"; import { AppBar, Toolbar, Typography, Button, Container, Box, Grid, Paper, } from "@mui/material"; import { createTheme, ThemeProvider } from "@mui/material/styles"; import LinkedInIcon from "@mui/icons-material/LinkedIn"; import GitHubIcon from "@mui/icons-material/GitHub"; import { Link as ScrollLink, Element } from "react-scroll"; import "./HomePage.css"; import homeImage from '../images/home.png'; const theme = createTheme({ palette: { primary: { main: "#004643", }, secondary: { main: "#FAF4D3", }, background: { default: "#0C1618", // Main background color }, text: { primary: "#FAF4D3", // Main text color secondary: "#FAF4D3", // Accent text color }, }, typography: { h1: { fontSize: "3rem", fontWeight: 700, marginBottom: "1rem", }, h2: { fontSize: "2rem", fontWeight: 500, marginBottom: "1rem", }, body1: { fontSize: "1.25rem", marginBottom: "1.5rem", }, button: { fontSize: "1rem", fontWeight: 600, }, }, }); function HomePage() { return ( Resume Management Tool for LaTeX {/* Features Button */} {/* Documentation Button */} {/* Left Side Content */} Welcome to the Resume Management Tool Simplify Your Resume Creation Manage and generate LaTeX resumes in seconds. Start now to take control of your professional documents with ease. {/* Right Side Image */} Key Features Translate Filter Easily translate your resume into multiple languages with a single click. Our tool integrates seamlessly with Google Translate API, ensuring accuracy and efficiency. Date Filter Filter your resume by date effortlessly. Manage different versions and track career progression with ease, generating customized resumes based on specific timeframes. Theme Filter Simplify your resume customization with the keyword filter. Set a specific keyword, and seamlessly identify and highlight relevant tokens of your resume. Section Filter Streamline your resume by section. Customize your resume by selecting only the relevant sections, enhancing clarity and relevance. Subsection Filter Streamline your resume by subsection. Customize your resume by applying filters to specified subsections. Reorder Filter Arrange resume sections effortlessly. Rearrange your resume sections as needed to emphasize key strengths and experiences. Documentation {/* Part 1: Restrictions */} Best Practices and Restrictions
  1. Try to avoid adding comments.
  2. Be mindful when translating the resumesometimes certain words may get translated that shouldnt be.
  3. Keep section names simple and avoid using special characters.
  4. If you need to apply a date filter easily, add this custom command at the start of your document:{" "} {"\\newcommand{\\daterange}[1]{#1}"}

    Whenever you want to include a date range, use it like this: {"\\daterange{2014-2020}"}
{/* Part 2: DSL Explanation and Query Examples */} Custom Query Language Documentation The Domain-Specific Language defined provides a structured way to query and manipulate resumes using specific commands. It allows users to perform operations such as selecting sections, filtering by criteria like dates or themes, translating content into different language, reordering resume sections and deleting sections. The DSL aims to simplify the management and customization of resumes by offering a clear syntax for executing these tasks efficiently. Command Syntax

Show Section List Filtered By Conditions

Translate From Language TO Language

Reorder Section List

Drop Section List

Query Examples

Example 1: Selecting specific sections

Show 'Work experience', 'Education'
-- Returns a file only with the Work Experience and Education sections


Example 2: Selecting all sections

Show *
-- Returns a file with all sections. This should generate the same document


Example 3: Filtering a Section by Date :

Show *
Filtered By SECTION = 'Education' AND DATE >= '2010'
-- Returns the entire file, but filters the Education Section to include only entries from 2010 onward.


Example 4: Filtering a Section by One Date and a Subsection by a Different Date :

Show *
Filtered By (section = 'Education Universitary' AND DATE > '2010') OR (subsection = 'Chair person' AND DATE = '2010')
-- Returns the entire file, filtering the specified section and subsection according to the given dates. Note: The specified subsection is not associated with the given section.


Example 5: Filtering the entire file by date

Show * Filtered By DATE > '2010'
-- Returns the entire file, filtering by date


Example 6: Filtering the document by Date, Except for a Specified Section:

Show * Filtered By SECTION != 'Education' and DATE > '2010'
-- Filter the entire document by the specified date, except for the specified section. Note: The condition Date > 2010 is applied to all sections except Education which is excluded from the filter. The priority is given to excluding the Education section before applying the date filter to the rest.


Example 7: Filtering file for specific sections and date

Show 'Professional Experience', 'Education' Filtered By DATE > '2010'
-- Returns only the sections 'Professional Experience' and 'Education' with dates greater than 2010


Example 8: Selecting specific sections, filtering subsection for date

Show 'Professional Experience', 'Education' Filtered By subsection = 'Chair person' and date > '2010'
-- Returns only the sections 'Professional Experience' and 'Education' filtering the subsection 'Chair person' by date


Example 9: Translating the resume into another language

Translate From 'fr' ; To 'en' ;
-- Translates the resume from French to English


Example 10: Reordering sections

Reorder 'Professional Experience', 'Education', 'Projects'
-- Reorders the sections of the resume as specified

Example 11: Deleting sections

Drop 'Professional Experience', 'Education', 'Projects'
-- Deletes the sections or subsections of the resume as specified

Try Now! Upload your LaTeX resume file and see the magic happen. Our tool will process your file and provide you a simple query language to manage your resume. 2024 Jlio Gonalves. All rights reserved. ); } export default HomePage;
